text: We have successfully created a CMS React project and uploaded it. We are able to add modules to pages etc, so it’s functioning just fine. However I can’t see the project as described in the CRM page - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/create-a-project#view-the-project-in-HubSpot|View the project in HubSpot>. My understanding was that if we are using CMS-React we will be able to see the projects regardless of the HubSpot products we’ve purchased. I do not have access to the “CRM UI Extensions” beta option. Also I’m pretty sure I had access to projects last week. Has something changed?

Figured it out (for anyone searching): when you do `hs project upload` a URL to see the build results will be output like
```<https://app.HubSpot.com/developer-projects/><portal-id>/project/<project-name>/build/3```
Navigating to the URL opens a page titled “Development (Beta)” which includes a list of projects and other helpful information.

Is there a way to navigate to this page from the main menu?
Do you see “CRM Development” in the HS app top-level navigation?
Ok, hm. It would be here… I’m not as familiar with the product constraints when it does not show up, will have to look into that.
Hi guys, quick question, any special command to delete duplicate modules?
